What is Pustefix
is a framework that helps you to develop web based applications (referred to as projects here). A high level view of the system is given on this page. The framework consists of two more or less independent parts:
A machinery to apply recursive XSLT transformations that produces the UI of the web application. You can learn more about this here.
A Java framework that takes input from the UI to change the application data and supplies changes of the application data back to the UI. This part is explained in much more detail here
Together, the framework acts similar to the Model-View-Controller pattern.
Sourceforge uses CVS, mailing list, web space and other services supplied by SourceForge. You can go to the project page here.
Development news
There has been no release for a long time, sorry about that. I try to do that more often, but if there is no recent release, the best you can do is using the CVS tree and create the needed files yourself (just type ant notag). We try hard to have the CVS tree compilable at all times, although we can't make any guarantees, of course.
The transition to ant is complete. You need to have at least ant 1.5.4.
because of the long time without a stable release, there are numerous changes to many to list them here. I tried to report on any bigger change to the mailing list, plese look there (there are not that many postings). For a better overview, please look into the ChangeLog file.
